introduction.title: CODING LANGUAGE
introduction.description: Coding languages, also known as programming languages, are a set of rules, symbols, and syntax used to create instructions for computers to execute. These instructions, called code, are written in a particular programming language and are used to develop software applications, websites, games, and more.

collection.name: C
collection.description: C is a low-level, general-purpose, compiled, programming language. It is used to develop operating systems, softwares, kernels and also compilers for languages and frameworks.

collection.name: C++
collection.description: C++ is a middle-level, object-oriented, programming language created as an extension of C. It is much more versatile and efficient as compared to its predecessor and is used for the same.

collection.name: C#
collection.description: C# is a high-level, object-oriented, functional programming language. It is used to develop cross-platform applications, since it is fully integrated into the .Net Core and .Net Framework.

collection.name: Java
collection.description: Java is an high-level, object-oriented programming language. It has a modern architecture and is mainly used to develop Android Applications, Web Applications and other GUI Apps.

collection.name: Kotlin
collection.description: Kotlin is a high-level, object-oriented, programming language. It is fully interoperable with Java and is used as an alternative. Used to develop Android and other high-level applications.

collection.name: Python
collection.description: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language. It has a very easy syntax and has a rich collection of libraries and modules. Known for Machine Learning and Data Science.

collection.name: Dart
collection.description: Dart is a high-level, object-oriented, compiled, programming language. It used as the core language of the Flutter framework, used to develop cross-platform Mobile Applications.

introduction.title: FRAMEWORKS & TOOLS
introduction.description: Frameworks are a collection of enterprise-grade libraries and packages. We can develop native and cross-platform applications of various kinds, using these frameworks. You can build video games, web, mobile, and desktop applications. Usually, a framework is written in a single language, but many frameworks also support multi-language integration.

collection.name: HTML
collection.description: HTML or Hyper-Text Markup Language is used to define the content and structure of the website. One of the oldest and most popular front-end languages. Popularly used alongside CSS & JavaScript.

collection.name: CSS
collection.description: CSS or Cascading Stylesheets is used to define the properties of the html elements, and design the overall website. Used to develop beautiful websites with animations and effects. Used alongside HTML & JavaScript.

collection.name: JavaScript
collection.description: CSS or Cascading Stylesheets is used to define the properties of the html elements, and design the overall website. Used to develop beautiful websites with animations and effects. Used alongside HTML & CSS.

collection.name: React Js
collection.description: React Js is a JavaScript framework developed by Meta, used to build the front-end websites much faster, more efficiently, and more optimized then the native standard languages like HTML, CSS & JavaScript.

collection.name: Angular Js
collection.description: Angular Js is a JavaScript framework, used to build the front-end websites much faster, more efficiently, and more optimized then the native standard languages like HTML, CSS & JavaScript.

collection.name: Vue Js
collection.description: Vue Js is a JavaScript framework, used to build the front-end websites much faster, more efficiently, and more optimized then the native standard languages like HTML, CSS & JavaScript.

collection.name: Node Js
collection.description: Node Js is a runtime environment that provides various back-end services, like Express Js, a popular server-side library. Node Js has a rich collection of web services provided by the Node Package Manager (NPM).

collection.name: Django
collection.description: Django is a server-side framework developed in Python. You can easily set up and manage every aspect of your server with Python and a collection of modules.

collection.name: Spring Boot
collection.description: Java Spring Framework (Spring Framework) is a popular, open source, enterprise-level framework for creating standalone, production-grade web application and microservices with Spring Framework faster and easier

collection.name: Dotnet Core
collection.description: .Net Core is a server-side framework, made by Microsoft, for building cross-platform, multi page web applications. Using the C# programming language and features provided by Razor, one can make enterprise=level web application and APIs

collection.name: Dotnet Blazor
collection.description: .Net Core Blazor & Blazor Web Assembly are two frameworks provided under the .Net Core. With these frameworks, you can cross-platform, single-page web applications and manage them directly via Microsoft Servers.

collection.name: Lavarel
collection.description: Laravel is an open-source PHP framework that follows a model-view-controller design pattern and reuses existing components of different frameworks. The web application thus designed is more structured and pragmatic.

collection.name: Unity
collection.description: Unity is a cross-platform game engine developed by Unity Technologies. The engine supports a variety of desktop, mobile, console and virtual reality platforms.

collection.name: Unreal Engine
collection.description: Unreal Engine is a cross-platform game engine and video rendering software. The engine uses C/C++ to develop 3D games and render high-quality animations.

collection.name: Godot
collection.description: Godot Engine is a feature-packed, cross-platform game engine to create 2D and 3D games from a unified interface. Using re-usable set of tools.

collection.name: GameMaker Studio
collection.description: GameMaker is a collection of cross-platform game engines used to develop 2D and 3D games. It uses the GameMaker Language

collection.name: Amazon Lumberyard
collection.description: Lumberyard is a cross-platform, open-source game engine made by Amazon. It is fully integrated with Amazon Web Services to develop games on a unified code base and architecture.

collection.name: Pygames
collection.description: Pygame is a cross-platform set of Python modules designed for writing video games. It includes computer graphics and sound libraries designed to be used with the Python programming language.

collection.name: Android Studio
collection.description: Android Studio is an IDE and an android graphics rendering engine, developed by Google. Using Java or Kotlin, and a rich collection of packages, one can make android applications with ease.

collection.name: Apple XCode
collection.description: The Apple XCode is an IDE and apple graphics rendering engine, developed by Apple. With a rich set of tools and packages, one can make iOS applications with Swift.

collection.name: Flutter
collection.description: Flutter is a cross-platform mobile app development framework, developed by Google. It has rich libraries dealing with UI, visual effects, animations, sound effects, and more, all written in Google's Dart.

collection.name: React Native
collection.description: React Native is a cross-platform mobile app development framework, developed by Meta. Built with the React framework and JavaScript, it uses similar libraries, packages and architecture to build mobile apps.

collection.name: Xamarin Forms
collection.description: Xamarin Forms is a cross-platform mobile app development framework, developed by Xamarin & Microsoft. One can build mobile apps using C# and a vast collection of libraries, all integrated into Visual Studio.

collection.name: NativeScript
collection.description: NativeScript is the open-source framework for building native Android and iOS applications with web technologies. This means we can develop native mobile applications with JavaScript, TypeScript, and/or Angular.
